page.title: 07OFF THE BEATEN TRACK.
page.content: There is{one bus each way}passing through Finzean daily,to Aberdeen at 7.30 and from there at 18.30.Most people travel to work by car or motor cycle.Young persons wishing to live at home and work elsewhere must be mobile and so most families need more than one car.There is no petrol station in Finzean.A gallon of petrol costs Â£2.00 but the return bus fare to Aberdeen is Â£4.10. A{school bus}takes Secondary pupils to and from Aboyne Academy and a{school} {taxi}brings most of the Primary pupils to Finzean school.Tarland school mini_ bus runs a shopping trip to Banchory via Finzean on Wednesday mornings. There is a{daily postal service}by van from Banchory and almost every home has a telephone. {Police patrols from Banchory}pass through occasionally.
